intro: Diplusodon scaber, commonly known as the roughleaf sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia, typically growing in wetland or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are covered in a rough, scaly texture, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family. Diplusodon scaber is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various invertebrates.
